user_auth.views module

user_auth.views.authenticate_user(request)[source]

This function defines how to authenticate a user. It takes the user input and tries to log them in.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – This requests the user to type the username

  • password (str) – This requests the user to type their corresponding password

  • user – This authenticates the information entered by the user. If it matches a user that has been saved in the database, then a welcome page is displayed by calling the show user function. If it does not match to an existing user, then the output will be None, and the user is redirected to the login page where they can select to register.

user_auth.views.registration_page(request)[source]

This function registers new users by requesting the necessarry information.

user_auth.views.show_user(request)[source]

This function displays a welcome page upos succesfull user login.

user_auth.views.user_login(request)[source]

This function takes the user to the login page

user_auth.views.user_logout(request)[source]

This function logs the user out and returns them to the login page
